And in following my new half-star policy, bumping up to 5 stars because the gals at the counter were so welcoming to everyone who came in.  And Mr. Casella himself took the time to say hello while we were waiting.  They also run a buy 2-get 1 free special during the week late afternoons.

Before there was a Defalco's or any of the trendier places around town, there was Casella's. I know this because it's been around almost as long as I have been and I grew up in the neighborhood. The Valley National Bank next door is long gone and the strip center has remodeled, but the deli is in the same spot. I have memories of being sent on my bike with a few bucks by my mom to pick up some subs for the family when she didn't want to cook. So how does it stack up today? Our family came back for lunch. 

It has not changed much over the years. The same 1970s paneling is on the walls, and the Saguaro senior class photos still dominate the decor. 

The primary difference between the sausage sub I ate in my youth to the one I had yesterday is the bread today is better: a solid crunch on the roll while still light inside. My wife's chicken steak was tasty, and the marinara is awesome. I didn't get to try a bit of my parents' cold subs but they finished them both happily. 

Everyone behind the counter that I saw was a family member (again, I grew up in the neighborhood: if you went to Mohave & Saguaro in the 70s & 80's or you went to St. Maria's you knew or knew of the Casella's) and this means they will close for summer vacation in July and close during the Christmas holidays to take a break. And yes, it's still cash only. But coming here for lunch felt like coming home. I may live in Texas now, but my heart will always be in this part of Scottsdale.

Awesome food! Great customer service! I had the pizza hoagie and wow it was delicious! I've never had a pizza hoagie before but I'm glad I chose it because it was super tasty and I'll defiantly be back for another on in the future! This is my new favorite sandwich joint! BRING CASH!

I was inspired to visit Casella's after a coworker told me about their authentically Italian goodness. As my tummy growled today, I was in the neighborhood so I knew just where to go. I walked into a simple yet clean deli. Immediately, I was welcomed by the entire staff (I believe they are all related or at least family through friendship). They asked me if it was my first time in and I said yes, so right away they started giving me a history of the shop and the tasty cuisine. Celebrating their 33rd anniversary (congrats!!), I learned that everything is homemade -- from the meatballs to the chicken salad. The owner said he goes through 40 lbs of chicken a week. He gave me a sample and the chicken was chunky and delicious. I'm not surprised he has to prepare so much chicken every week! The meatballs and freshly cut meat for Philly Cheese-steak sandwiches looked great too! The owner mentioned he is from Philly so better be ready for some authentic Philly and Italian style cookin'! 

While I was there, the owner was slicing some fresh provolone, so I added that to the warmed turkey sandwich I ordered. The turkey was tasty, the provolone was yummy and the sourdough roll tasted like it was fresh from the oven. It was $8 for a sandwich and soda but the sandwich was hefty enough that I saved half for later. As I walked out, everyone said goodbye to me and I felt like I was leaving a family dinner. 

In summary, here's what made Casella's stand out: 

- The very friendly staff
- It's a local family-owned neighborhood deli celebrating their 33rd anniversary. Gotta support the local businesses! 
- Clean decor 
- Tasty, homemade food that's on display for visitors to see 
- A good family-style atmosphere that greets you the second you walk inside. 

I'm not sure how it's taken my so long to find this local treat, but now that I've found it, I plan on becoming a regular. 

Directions: Note that this is hidden in the Basha's strip mall (on the side of Granite Reef) but don't let that fool you!
visitor from other state -  Outstanding and friendly staff and foods is CHAMP! Thumbs up

Yes, I am a fan.

First, bring cash if you're going here.

Love the Italian family atmosphere. Run by the same family for many years, and it shows. Food was great, and the counter person, a daughter of the owners, was very helpful and friendly. I had an Italian Beef Sandwich, and being from Chicago where the Beef Sandwich is king, I enjoyed it a lot.

It's busy as hell at lunch time, but the family crew moved like a well-oiled machine to get everyone their food in a very reasonable amount of time.

My one, and only real con. Cash only. It's time to step up to modern retailing and accept credit cards. Luckily, I had cash when I went in, but I saw customers walk out because they weren't carrying enough to cover their purchase.

Definitely, check it out, and bring cash.

We are in town for spring training and I found this place on Yelp. So glad we did. Joe is the friendliest guy you'll ever meet and takes so much pride in his food and business. The restaurant is about to celebrate its 39th anniversary. We got the cold Italian hoagie, health salad and Denise's chocolate chip cookies. The meat in the sandwich was amazing and what a bargain. You can get half a cold sandwich for just $3.90. My only disappointment was that the bread was a little dry. The health salad with marinated peppers, cucumber, carrots and celery was delicious and refreshing. The cookies were delicious and homemade (2 for $1!). Happy to support a great family business!
Love to find these places, 40 years of family owned and operated goodness! The staff/owners were very friendly and the food was amazing!

Found this place via Yelp. Had never eaten in the neighborhood before. Most people write about how nice the staff here is and they are right. Nicest people to ever run a deli. Their meatball sub is also amazing!

37 years and counting! Casellas is one of the best lunch spots in town. Family owned and operated, always friendly and the food is consistently delicious. The Pastrami sandwich and the Cheesesteak are both excellent but don't forget to try the potato salad and their home made cannoli!

Wrote about this before, but in case you're wondering if the place has lost its edge, the short answer is NO!!!!

Absolutely the BEST place for sandwiches and Italian dishes - all homemade.  Jump in the car, climb on the bike ... but GO!
I've been eating here since i was a kid and will be taking my son here too! I love that they keep it simple and its family run. The chicken salad is the best.

You simply can't find a more delightful hostess.   She is the daughter of the owners and calls everyone by their first name and really goes out of her way to ensure that the customers are welcomed and enjoying their Italian deli food.  I had the steak and cheese which was delicious.  The steak was such high quality meat and the cheese was delicious as well.  The homemade lemonade was perfect.  My only advice to the owning family is to buy a machine to serve soft drinks on tap which is always so delicious with sandwiches.  The atmosphere is a cute ma and pa place which reminds all customers, "You're not in a Subway."  Come here for great food and a fun time.

This place is great. I've been here several times now. Looks like it is family-owned and operated. They seem to really care about the place and their customers.

An old-school hoagie shop which reminded me of similar places in Philly and NJ.

Food is really good, fast and very reasonably priced.

Very casual atmosphere. Very busy at lunch, sometimes empty at other times.

Service is extremely friendly and genuine.

Highly recommended.

Love this family owned Italian deli.  They are the cooks and that staff, and they always remember your name, even when you have not been their in years.  Love the photos of the senior classes from Saguaro High School, definitely supports the locals.  Get the chicken salad sandwich or the chicken steak, you will not be disappointed.

Eating at Casella's is like coming home to a home-cooked meal - if you live in Philly and have great cooks in your family.  No wonder they just celebrated 40 years in business.
People: The Casella family is so unbelievably nice! I met Dad and the two daughters who were working that day. They are friendly and welcoming to everyone; he even came and sat at my table to chat. 5 stars for the owners.
Food: Oh.my.word! I ordered a beef sandwich with peppers and onions. They showed me the paper-thin beef before they cooked it to perfection and served it on a beautifully soft white roll. My mouth was full of deliciousness. They also offered samples from their selection. The coleslaw was not too sweet and not overdressed, so very good. The chicken salad sample had a bit too much creaminess for my liking, but was still flavorful. They make everything from scratch (except the pickles) and I look forward to trying more offerings. 5 stars for the sandwich alone.
Ambience: This is a no-frills environment, but it's light and clean and full of lovely people. One wall is covered with pictures of the graduating classes of Saguaro High School since the 80s - because that's where all 4 daughters attended - so 5 stars for hometown appeal.
I simply can't wait to go visit again and say "Hi!" to my new family.

Remember when l told what a nice family the Casellas were.
Oops!  I was wrong. The two bratty rude sisters did not seem to appreciate loyal longstanding customers. The average food seemed to taste better when some kindness is there. What phony's!

Always fresh delish food, that has a reputation known by all in the area. I have a business across the street and all my clients rant about the food from here. When you step inside you will feel like your welcomed as a part of this family that runs this business. Simply extraordinary to be so lucky to come by a establishment ran such as this. Scottsdale's little secret among best food one can find and top ran business!!!
Thanks Shannon M. for turning me onto this place.  The meatball sandwich was fantastic.  Loved the family owned and operated service.

I've been eating at Casella's for years!! I used to live down the street and go more often then I do now but even when I'm in the area, I try and stop by. The decor is old but if you look past that, you will discover the family friendliness and food are incredible! I usually order the turkey sub but their chicken salad sub is THE BEST! Unfortunately, this place isn't super healthy but boy is it tasty!

Just remember to bring cash because they don't accept anything else!!

A friend told me about this little hole in the wall. I bet I have driven by this place many times and never knew it was there. Yes, it is cash only but if you know that before you go, what is the big complaint? This is a family business. The interior reminds me of many of the Italian restaurants in Buffalo, NY, wood panels, tables and metal chairs, nothing fancy but this is a sandwich place, I don't need fancy, I need good. 

The two women asked my name, welcomed me and I placed my order to go. I ordered an Philly Cheese steak with onions and a chicken salad sandwich. Both were delicious. The bread is the best roll I have had in Phoenix. Just like back east. Out here in Phoenix the bread they serve at sandwich places is...YUCK, kind of subway sandwich bread. To me the roll is important and this one hit the spot. 

Very casual, limited hours, Monday Thru Friday, 11Am to 6Pm, Saturday, 11Am to 3PM. I am definitely a regular now.

Absolutely local home town family owned amazing fresh hand cut and roasted with care each day Philly cHeEsE steak that melts in your mouth !!! I cAnT bElieve I aTe tHe WhOLe Thang . . . . . . Amazing Lasagna too !!

The chicken salad sandwich is life changing! I mean life changing!! I can not believe that it took me so long to write my review. I guess I to busy California dreaming about another sandwich! My fianc brought me to Scottsdale for my birthday so we were yelping all over the place!

We both ordered sandwiches from this place and I have to say it s a GEM the owner knew Lot of people who walked in and was super super nice and was happy to give suggestions so I landed on the chicken salad sandwich. And I haven't stopped thinking about that sandwich since.

Unfortunately I can't even remember what my fianc got because I made a pig of myself and demolished my sandwich I gave my fianc a look and dared him to ask for a bite lol. I kid I kid I shared. I usually do share upon request 

This place is local and it's always great to support local business even if you are not from the area and the fact that they have good service and and GREAT FOOD!!!
Small mom and pop deli with very friendly owners that work there.  Had the pastrami, which was very good along with potato salad.
The service is wonderful, friendly people, and the service is wonderful. This place deserves a six star rating. A must try!

I first visited this establishment in 1981 back when we were able to leave high school for lunch. It was a favorite until I moved in 1982. After 35 years of being deprived of the best family made subs in town, today's steak and cheese was fantastic, and just as it was back in school. I hope to get another visit in for the Pizza Hoagie before I leave. Sometimes good things never change.

10/22/17. Today I had the Pizza Hoagie before heading back out to Florida. Wow...just as it was 35 years ago, Fantastic. Can't say enough good comments about Casellas. Thanks again Joe for being who you are :)
Really good sandwiches. A bit slow but authentic mom and pop place, I'll go back for sure. I have the sausage sandwich, hot. Their chocolate italian cookies were very good as well.
Excellent sandwich. Good pasta salad. And it's a fantastic throwback style place and the people are really nice.

This is a very good daily highly recommended I wanted to get some fresh meat I ended up getting cheese and bread and couple sandwiches and the people that got them for they were also very happy prices were reasonable and the service was great I highly recommend this place I will definitely be back

We aren't part of the Casella family, but we feel like we are when we visit this traditional family deli. The chicken salad sandwiches are legendary, but the sausage and peppers are my favorite. And don't forget the deli pickles.
Sort of like being back east.

Simply amazing. Old school feel, almost feels like I am back in philly. Staff is so friendly and it is a family run place. I have had the pastrami which is delicious and also had a turkey sandwich. Bread is what makes this sandwich. I want to try more of what they have. Will go back. You should go try, if have not already

I don't see what the hype is all about with this place. I didn't think my meal was that great. Nothing I couldn't put together quickly at home. The place is old. And seriously, cash only? 

The man behind the counter was nice. The other lady that was there seemed nice.

This place was recommended by several Yelpers on the Talk board, so I decided to give it a shot for lunch one day.  Since everyone recommended the Italian Hoagie, I decided to order it.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GTuAPBRsM5dVPqPy9oe14Q?select=wlDWkJfzaYGWqDVviW9-og
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GTuAPBRsM5dVPqPy9oe14Q?select=YIheIM7GeCTUlLRrczkM_Q

The Bread on the Hoagie was pretty good, but I thought it was a little on the dry side.  Would have enjoyed a little more Oil in it.  The ingredients tasted fresh and it was a solid Sandwich.....not the best I ever had, but pretty good.  Will have to come back to try some of their other stuff.

They're not open on Sundays, so I'll have to try and squeeze in a visit during the week.

Return Factor - 85%

This place is incredible. The food is good, but what puts this deli over the top are the people there. When you walk in you're treated like family. The owner John came and sat down with us and shared all sorts of stories. The lady working the front counter, Denise, was so nice and friendly. She was delightful. It really felt like family. You've got to experience this place for yourself. The chicken salad is a must have ;)

While I love each and every visit to Casella's, today was something special - Casella's was celebrating an anniversary - 34 years in business!!

There is something to be said about good food and a friendly atmosphere that stands the test of time.  It is easy to see why this family-run business has been open for 34 years and counting.

Since first discovering this local gem with my Favorite Yelper a few months ago, I have lost count of the number of visits we have made.  Each and every time, we are greeted like family.  Denise even remembers our order!  Well, to be honest, every customer is greeted like family.  That is one of the many reasons we can't stay away.

The decor is unpretentious, and the wood-paneled, nostalgia-filled walls tell the story of years of being a staple in the community.  Don't be surprised if you are offered a taste of whatever is being sliced behind the counter - thank you again Joe, for that Provolone!  :)

Ready to taste a little bit of heaven?  Order the Hot Italian Beef with Provolone.  Served on a soft yet slightly crisp roll with a side of Au Jus, I struggle to find words to describe how good this sandwich is.  Just try it.  You won't be sorry.  

Maybe money can't buy you love, but it can get you a fantastic meal - Casella's is cash-only.

I have decided that I want to be adopted by the Casella family.  Sorry mom, but if you ever taste one of Casella's sandwiches, you will understand...

I went there based off yelpers. I got the steak works. I just was not impressed. It tasted ok. But I felt it was a little over priced for what I got. It did not come with any sizes. A pickle is a $1 extra. And the cannot lies were way over priced at 3$. 1.50$ would have been a better price. I get 8t they fill it to order so it is not soggy, but it still just a cannolli. So I give the food a two star. The people are super nice. So I gave them an extra star for that. Sorry no pictures. My photo was at 3 % and would not let me take a pic.

Casella's is better than Subway, but nothing particularly special.  The 4.5 star review it has is extremely inflated.  I didn't write a review for a long time, because I feel bad since it's a family business, and I do wish them the best of luck.  However, I don't like when businesses have undeserved high ratings.  It's not worth the trip to the ATM beforehand to pay cash only.  If you happen to be at Basha's next door, and are hungry for a sightly better than Subway sub, and have some cash on hand, it's not a bad experience.  If you aren't already in the area, however, it's not worth the extra effort.

Amazing sandwiches! Stopped in here with my boys while we were out exploring the Scottsdale area and boy did we luck out! It's the perfect little family owned shop. The rolls were soft & fresh, the meatballs perfectly seasoned & the cheesesteaks were moist and delish! They're very filling too so we all took half our food with us to enjoy later! The pizelle (spelling) cookies are super light & have the perfect sweetness to them, I could eat a whole bag. YUMMY!! It's not always easy pleasing all 3 of my boys when eating out & I get so tired of my youngest eating chicken fingers or mac & cheese so I absolutely loved this little gem!! The family that runs it are the friendliest people ever. If you're in the area, go & enjoy!!!

This is your classic old school family run joint - The Cheers of Italian delis. The food is great, but the people running the place is first class, checking on you throughout the meal and engaging in conversation. Most of the food review has been hit already, but the chicken salad, Italian and pastrami were huge hits in our group.

Couple of tips:
- Cash only!
- If you're coming during a holiday weekend, be sure to call! We lucked out coming Friday before the Memorial Day weekend, but they're closed for the rest of the long weekend.
- Try the cannoli. They fill as you order it (like you're supposed to) so it's not soggy like a lot of other places.

This place is wonderful! Very homey, friendly and delicious! We had cheese steak sandwich and meatball sandwich there. They put some homemade tomato sauce on the top of sandwich. It was great! It was good big portion and very reasonable prices. Especially this summer, they have special deal 2-6pm B2G1! You should try!
Favorite place to grab a sub! Highly recommend! They've been here forever and always make the best food

Wow. What a sandwich. I have tried 3 things here. 

The Italian hoagie was pretty good. Lots of meat, but very oily. Like my hands were drenched. But no big deal. 

The chicken salad sandwich. This is my favorite!!!!! Omg its so good! Freaking delicious. 

Pasta salad. Great side order for your sandwich. Very tasty. 

Biggest problem with the place (and the reason I don't give it 5 stars) is that they only accept cash. Come on, what kind of place doesn't take credit cards these days? First time there I didn't have any on me & i had to drive all the way back home & come back since I already put my order in. Annoying. 

But give it a try some time. Very homey feeling too. Mom & pop sort of place.

The cheesesteaks are to die for. Every Friday is tradition to have Cassela's cheesesteaks, taste just like the ones in Philly. Get it with sauce and grilled onions :) the bread rolls are the secret I think. They get them specially made from a bakery and stop selling once they run out for the day. It feels like family when you walk in and everything on the menu is amazing. Remember that it's cash only!   A great part of going to Saguaro High School is hearing about Cassela's and then once graduating seeing the picture of your graduating class added to the wall.   There's nothing like Cassela's :)

Their meatball subs are fantastic. I know I should try their other food but once I had that sub I was hooked! Pre-sub I enjoyed lasagna, spaghetti, and a nice variety of pickled and pasta salads. The family is great, they will even open the doors if you show up at closing time which we once did. Love the photo of Papa Casella with the Pope.

Joe and he family are a hidden gem in a world where food and experience no longer meet in one place. The food was incredible. Be prepared to bring cash as no Credit but this makes the hidden gem that much more precious. I would put this place on my bucket list of Scottsdale treasures. 40 years strong and I see why. Thank you Casellas for making my trip. Casellas has all homemade food and you can tell it is made with love. 5 star rated great price and even more amazing family dynamic lost in many Delis nationwide. MUST GO TO!!!! If I lived here I would be a regular. Thank you Casellas

Now I wish I would have actually gone to pick up my samich instead of sit at work and wait for it's arrival.  I had heard very good things about this deli, so when i finally got bored of the same ole lunch I bring to work every day it was time to get in on this following.  I had the italian sub on wheat bread.  Um, talk about Freshness!  I'm pretty sure I ate the whole thing in like 3 minutes because I just couldn't get enough.  The bread was so soft, the meat was outstanding, and the provolone was real!  Alll it had was oil and vinegar on it with lettuce tomato and the typical italian meats.  I normally cannot eat a sandwhich without mayo and mustard, specially some spicy brown.  That was wonderful, but now after reading these reviews, it's time for me to check out that Chicken Salad, I love chicken salad.
I've been coming here since highschool! Great friendly neighborhood deli with amazing sandwhiches!!
Everything is really good, meatball sandwich is exceptional. True home cooking, family business. This is a must eat at place !
Superb neighborhood deli!  Delicious quality food, great value, fast friendly service!

My only regret is that I have just now found this place. In business for over 35 years. Walking in for the first time and I was welcomed as if I was visiting their home. I was introduced to the owners and two of their four daughters. "Everything is homemade", they proudly proclaimed! I was handed a taste of their special chicken salad and I will never eat chicken salad anywhere else! Joe the owner said he personally debones the chicken daily and his wife has the secret sauce recipe. Their meat for the chesse steaks are all hand cut, no precut steak-ums here. Canollis are hand made to order so they arent soggy. Gotta try it! Oh, cash only by the way. There is a Basha's in the center if you need to go grab a pack of gum to get cash back! Im going again today. tee hee
Thanks Hailey P. for the heads up, that they are a cash only business. Kids enjoyed their cold subs to go. Don't leave without a bag of pizelles, they were excellent!

What a hidden gem! Noticed the great reviews so I had to give it a try. Excellent food and service! Family owned, the owners are genuine and very friendly. The Steak works is sooo good! Highly recommended!! FYI place is cash only
The real deal Italian deli. The cheesesteak and Italian beef sandwich were both fantastic. Friendly establishment.....expect the owners to come chat with you and find out where you're from.

One of the best places to get real home cooked deli food... Meatballs, Roast Beef, Chicken Salad, Baked Beans... And a host of other delicious food.. All home cooked, prepared and served by the wonderful and friendly Casella family.

In town for a short weekend trip and wanted a quick lunch.  Saw the reviews on Yelp and figured we had to give it a try.   Well, we loved it.    The service is amazing and friendly.   Joe, the owner, and his daughter, were lovely to chat with.     

Food is fresh and prepared when you order.

I'm not sure how to write this review without telling a story. I normally don't write dissertations, favoring the short and sweet condensed review, so if it's a little verbose, bear with me as it's a story worth reading.

We've heard about Casella's for years but have never eaten there, usually due to bad timing on our part as they close early on Saturday and are not open for business on Sundays. 
We finally made it there today during normal business hours.

Not knowing what to expect, we decided prior to going in if we weren't impressed with the menu, or the joint itself, we'd give each other the signal and find another lunch place.
Well we weren't impressed with the decor, the menu or the overall ambiance, so we gave each other the nod and started for the door. 
That's when the owner, Joe Casella stopped us.
Recognizing us as newbies, he told us all about his restaurant,  the menu, and even offered us a taste of whatever we liked.
We declined, perhaps being a bit skeptical.
But then something interesting happened. 
Joe introduced us to his wife and two of his four daughters (who were on duty) and we were instantly enamored with this family. 
Who does that in 2011? Seriously. He asked our names and even shook my hand. 
Long story short, after talking with Joe for just a few short minutes, my wife and I gave each other a reverse nod, signaling our eagerness to try something...anything! 
We ordered a couple sandwiches on Joe's recommendation.
The food was superb.
The bread was one of the best rolls I've ever had and is enough reason by itself  to keep us coming back. Crusty and not overly breaded, it reminded me of the rolls in Atlantic City where the bread is pure perfection. 
Same for the sandwich ingredients, full of flavor and cooked just right.

But the best part was how Joe came over to talk to us after finishing our meal. He wanted our candid opinion of the food and service.
If there's any single reason for me to frequent this place, it's the genuine heartfelt sincerity of the owner and his family, not to mention the food!

Sure, the decor is old and needs updating, but somehow, after meeting the family, and eating lunch, I didn't care about the decor, or the no-nonsense menu, or the layout. None of that mattered anymore. 
What mattered was the overall experience of a true family restaurant, their wholesome foods, and being in the company of genuinely warm people. 

In a time when most of us tend to rely on first impressions, judging the proverbial book by its cover almost caused us to miss out on the Casella's experience had it not been for Joe Casella taking our hand and welcoming us into his unique domain.

Casella's took me back in time today, when my grandparents would often take me with them to the Italian deli for lunch. 
As they visited with the owner (in Italian), sipped espresso for what seemed like hours, and ate a slow lunch, I wanted to die. I remember sitting there in the booth fidgeting as they talked, hoping like hell we'd get out of there soon.
I hated that experience as a kid.
I loved it today as an adult, but more importantly, finally recognized and appreciated the gift my grandparents unknowingly gave me. 
Thank-You Joe

I will gladly drive 40 miles from my house to Casella's for their food.

They have become my top stop Italian deli.

Recently, I tried their Italian and cheesesteak sandwiches.  Both were awesome.

I also love their salads.  I had the pasta and chicken salad.  The chicken salad receives my only small complaint, because it is a little too thick for my taste.

Maybe they need to ease up on the mayonnaise or something.  I don't know.

This place gets extremely busy around lunch time, but the service is quick.  Try to remember that they do not take debit / credit cards or checks.  Cash is king.

The Casella family is like a well-oiled machine: dad runs around, making sure everything is orderly and clean, while mom and the daughters handle cooking, food prep, and the front counter.

I simply love this place....even more than DeFalco's.
Family owned. Great people, great service and great sandwiches. Get the Pizza Hoagie but add a meatball to it!
The women who work and run this spot are so sweet. Great little locals spot. If you want to just come grab a quick Sammie in this area this is your spot.

FAMILY!! Small Italian deli that's perfect. Very friendly & welcoming, casual & awesome. It like stopping by your Dad & Mom's house while your cousins/ siblings are hanging out.  The food is fresh & just like you would make @ home.
Meatball sandwich was perfect (bread was crispy outside & soft inside) not messy & very tasty. 
Denise's cookies are terrific.

If we lived near here, we would be coming here every week! Family owned and operated and everyone is SO friendly. You hardly ever find places anymore that people actually take the time to say hi and get to know you. We ordered the hot pastrami and the cheesesteak with the works. Both were so delicious and came on amazing rolls! The coleslaw and pasta salad were both very good as well. This place is definitely worth going out of your way for- we will be back!

What a treat! Owned and operated by the same family for 40 years. Amazing sandwiches and couldn't have been a more friendly guy. We came in with a large group, he and his daughter turned out sandwiches out in no time. When I'm back in then Phoenix area I'll definitely be back I'm looking forward to trying the steak sandwich. The meatball sandwich has homemade sauce and I quote "not made from Prego, Ragu or that other stuff!" The sandwich takes a slight bit of a different approach as the meatballs are chopped rather than whole. 
Check out Casella's I'm sure they'll make you a fan.
I made a mistake and got a boring old turkey sub.  It was good, but I should've ordered something different.  The meat is fresh and the bread is true Italian bread! Great find!

I found this place on Yelp and based on the reviews I had great expectations. I liked that it was a locally owned business and that it was rather simple. Everyone on Yelp recommended the Philly Cheese steak. It definitely wasn't anything special, the meat was a little dry, the bread wasn't authentic cheese steak break but rather what you would find on any sub. I haven't had a cheese steak I like that uses provolone instead of whiz. The one awesome thing that came out of the experience was their homemade dog biscuits. My dog loved them and they were made of all natural ingredients.

Some friends took me here while I was in town from LA. Great sandwiches and from what I understand this is a family owned and operated business. I hear that their lasagna is good too. I'll have to try that next time for sure... 
PS- The price is right here. In LA I would have been stuck paying double for the cold cuts.
Love this place.  They're always so friendly and welcoming.  I've been coming here for years and I always love when I am near by to grab a delicious sandwich and lemonade!

This place is legit!!!!!  My company recently moved to the area and I'm always scouting for lunch places.  I found this place on yelp, read the reviews, found zero reviews below 4 stars, then I see locals frequent this place, you know it's legit.  Cash only, no worries.  I ran into WalMart, grabbed something and got cash back.  Super friendly staff, which seems to be the daughters of the family, all very friendly and attractive.  I will definitely be bringing my team members here for lunch.

This deli is in the Basha's shopping center on the corner of Granite Reef & MacDonalds facing toward Granite Reef.  Went there based on the reviews from yelp and was looking for a good hero with Italian bread.  I will not go back.  The place is very dirty and not at all inviting.  They did not slice the meat in front of me like I am used to with deli's the meat was in a cooler with the cheeses and condiments.  The same lady who does the cash register also makes your sandwiches and she does not wear gloves or washes her hands, very disgusting to eat food which someone handles money and then makes your sandwich without washing their hands.  The cashier did mention everything is homemade by her father which I had to wonder since they have boxes of food in their freezer not home made but the cheescake comes from someplace else.  The salads and rice pudding looked disgusting.  I know they just celebrated their 38th year but I wish they went back to when they had the slicer out and sliced the meats in front of you and washed their hands before service.  Not a good place to go for fresh food.  The hero was good my friend said I told him I would not eat it because the lady had dirty hands, but he ate it and like it.  if you go ask the lady to wash her hands first, not sure if she will but then ask her to use gloves if they have none, then you know what kind of establishment it is.  Good heros bad etiquette. They operate the same way as subway except subway employees wear gloves.  Want an authentic NY Hero from Subway just bring in a Hoagie roll and they will make you a sandwich, it is all about the bread. Casellas also raised their prices now a 6 inch Hero with roast beef and cheese is $7.65... no more $6 Heros.  Not worth it especially since their are other options and the food or the employees wash their hands or wear gloves elsewhere. Bacteria is terrible to get from someone not have the decency to wash their hands and touch food.  Disgusting, Disgusting, Disgusting!!!

Super nice people and outstanding food make this family owned non-pretentious sandwich shop a stand out.  I think it is a Mom and Pop with a few daughters running the place. They are all super sweet.  

The cheese steak is out of this world.  It is not your Philly style cheese steak. But it is a must have for me.  The meatball and Italian beef subs are a close 2nd choice.  And the cold Italian Combo sub, also delicious!  And I dig the yummy potato salad.  And definitely do not miss out on the amazing cookies ... off the hook!!  

They close at 6 PM, so hurry up and call in your order!

This place was awesome. just moved to the city and wanted to grab some good food with a buddy, found this place and saw it had good reviews so we gave it a try. 

We told the cashier we hadnt been there before and she tooks us through the menu and was super friendly. she went on to tell us how everything was fresh and store prepared. everything was made to order. 

while we were waiting, the owner came over and gave us samples of different dishes and told us what he recommended. he told us how the company started and where he came from.

the food came out and it was amazing. got the roast beef sandwich and it was easily the freshest roast beef I've ever had. after we ate, the owner showed us how he prepared everything fresh and why he did things the way he does. 

we went for lunch and left with a new favorite spot where we were treated like family. 

Thanks Chris and Joe, we will be back soon!

I have so many wonderful things to say about this place and not enough time. I am from the wonderful city of Chicago and let me tell you, I've had my fair share of AMAZING Italian food and this place fits right in.
The Casella family is welcoming and insanely friendly. I had great conversation while waiting for my beef. This very adorable family owned restaurant not only offers fabulous customer service but there Italian Beef was outstanding. The best I've had in the valley. I have been searching all over Phoenix for a Italian joint like this and I've finally found it. I have not yet tried other items on the menu but if they are as great as the Italian Beef, I'll be spending a lot of my time and money here. 



Kudos to the Casella family for a fabulous run restaurant with great food!

If you are looking for an excellent sandwich or hoagie go to Casella's. We ordered the Italian sandwich and pizza hoagie. Both were EXCELLENT! The atmosphere is a great family vibe. Can't wait to go back and try more sandwiches!

What can I say about Casellas...feels like home. You walk in from when it was 1987, 1997, or 2017...the place is the same. Warm, friendly greeting, family run establishment with the 2 girls I remember running the front while mom and dad in back. Specialty is the cheese steak..pepper steak...in fact any hoy steak sandwich. The Italian sandwich is epic. All of the homemade sides are amazing and the price is just right. If you are in the area, stop by, nothing fancy to expect from the building itself but the food is what Lunch dreams are made of. Closed on Sundays and they deserve it...great sandwich/deli. After 40 years...and still going strong. Iconic place for Scottsdale.
Wow... An unbeatable combination of homemade sandwiches that melt in your mouth and service that's second to none. We will be back. Best lunch I can remember in years.

This was the first stop for lunch upon arriving in Scottsdale from Toronto.

I wasn't blown away but I will agree with other yelpers that the staff was very friendly and they seemed to know everyone who came in. 

I'll start with the positives: 
- very inexpensive...the hot Italian beef with jus was only 7 bucks! 
- also got a half chicken salad sandwich (nice to be able to order half sizes for the cold sandwiches (note you can't do that with the hot sandwiches though)
- the cannoli was delicious!
- very friendly place that seemed to bring a lot of locals

The not so great if I am being picky
- I really don't like when the person handling the money touches the food. After I paid (cash only by the way) she took the sandwich and cut it in half and arranged it in the basket for us without gloves or washing hands first
- sandwiches were just ok, but commensurate with the price so I am not complaining.

All in all a cute joint and friendly but I likely would not be back.
So good. Love their chicken salad sandwich, Italian, turkey, club, potatoe salad, spaghetti, and cookies.  So much goodness here.
Just like home! If you live here but are from Philly/South Jersey you will feel like family! Best hoagies and cheesesteaks in AZ!

Buddy and I split half Pepper-steak and half Meatball with potato salad and extra marinara for my Meatball.  It was DELICIOUS.  Great service and very friendly.  I enjoyed how it was a CASUAL PLACE. Look forward to going back and trying some other fine sandwiches and salads.  Cannoli's looked FRESH.

LOVE Casella's!  Its a neighborhood classic.  The chicken salad, cheesesteak, turkey and potato salad are my favorites although having tried pretty much everything, you really cant go wrong.  Casella's is a family owned and operated restaurant.  Have a cannoli for dessert and tell Joe & Co. I said hi!

I met fellow Yelpers Brian S and Shannon M here and learned that it's all about the sandwich.  And feeling like you have walked on to a set for "That 60's show" or "That 70's Show".  It's pretty clear the owners of Casella's are focused on the sandwiches, not updating the decor.

I had an Italian beef sandwich.  It was great.  And I sat and soaked up the 70's decor as the bread from my sandwich was soaking up the juice.

This place is old school all the way - old school awesome.  F#%*ing A.  Now where's my Trans Am?
Love love love this place. My boyfriend turned me on to it and we cant get enough. For great food, friendly staff, and even better service this is the place for you

Happened to be in the area and had a craving for a cheese steak. Luckily I found these guys on yelp. Well worth taking the time to drive out of your way for. Definitely one of the best cheese steaks I've had in Arizona. Very welcoming and nice staff, it's all family run. Can't wait to go back.

Locally owned for around twenty years this is a true neighborhood fixture. While it's not going to win any decorator awards the people and the food here are off the charts. I'm talking about some really really good homemade food! I loved this place from the moment I walked in the door. *Beware they close for family vacations and the summer.

Awesome Italian deli. I got a cold turkey sandwich and my bf got an Italian hoagie. Both had fresh ingredients and tasted great! New favorite sandwich place. Just remember to have cash on you. Prices are also reasonable which is a plus!

My husband and are definite foodies, always looking for a great local place to eat. We stopped by Casellas for lunch and could not have been more pleased with our lunch! I had the cheese steak sandwich and my husband had the steak works with the sides of coleslaw and potato salad. It was heavenly and the family that ran the place were so friendly and kind. Clean facility, everything was fresh! A must eat!!

Amazing food. Fantastic service in a friendly family run business.  The food quality is outstanding and all made with care and passion. Prices seem too low for this quality of a product and service. I was fortunate enough to meet Joe, one of the owners and driving force behind this place.  What a treasure he is.  I had heard good things from a  friend who use to live here and went on Saturdays.  I will go back when I am in the area.  Take CASH. You will need about $15 for sandwich sides and a large drink with some left over for a tip (and the ladies deserve it).  Great place.

Great food, value and owners! Everything is homemade by Joe & Tina and their daughters. So refreshing to listen to the owners speak to ever customer like they are family. They knew everyone by name and took genuine interest in their life. While we were in town we visited twice. They were beyond thrilled to see us back again.

You have to love this place for the family and local history it has. It's refreshing in the sense it's not a cold cut franchise. The whole atmosphere is down home and welcoming. While I would like to say the food was unbelievable, I just can't. It certainly was not bad at all. It's just there are so many choices in this type of food and it didn't stand out for me. None-the-less, it's worth the visit to get a feel for what an ole time "family run" deli feels like.
Old school. Delicious. Family owned. Talk to Joe! You'll especially appreciate this place if your from back East. Philly cheese steak and chicken salad are winners.
Wonderful experience! We had an opportunity to meet the owner and enjoy a delicious pastrami sandwich and sausage sandwich. We highly recommend this place for an authentic deli experience.

I've stopped by here once after I got done grocery shopping. I read the reviews and anxiously wanted to give it a try. I ordered the Casella's Italian Sub and for some reason it did not live up to what I have read in all the other reviews. Maybe Casella's was having an off day. 

I am not marking it off from my list yet. I guess i will give Casella's another try. Hopefully it won't disappoint.

Since Arizona BBQ wasnt open i came to this mom and pop italliano deli that's celebrating 40 years...since 1977!  It's small but there is a slow but steady stream of customers coming in. Let's see what happens.....
Didn't  get what i ordered...cheese steak with peppers...no peppers to be found. Nobody likes when someone  tells them they didn't do something when they know for sure they did. Customers hate it even more (being called a liar instead of saying oops miscommunication).  I didnt turn my car around in 105 degree weather to get 30 cents worth of peppers for free,  i did it cuz owner talked it up so much i had to try sandwich at traffic light to see for myself how good the sandwich with peppers would be.
Okay. Enough soap boxing. 
The cheese steak has a very oniony tomatoe sauce with some mozzarella and it was good. I love onions.   It's a decent neighbourhood shop, but not really worth a pilgrimage for.  However, if you do go, bring cash because they don't accept any form of plastic and make sure to have them repeat order back to you!!
Giving 3 stars instead of 2 cuz i know miscommunication happens which is why they should write down the order for audit trail purposes instead of immediately assuming the customer doesn't know what they said.

When I was visiting Arizona, I figured that authentic Italian food would be hard to find. This place felt just like my Italian grandmother's house. When we walked in, the food smelled amazing, the owners were super friendly and the lasagna was legit.

Excellent food and service. My first time visiting them and I will be back. Like everyone else says, make sure you have cash. I tried the Italian and meatball. Meatball was excellent and Italian was good. I'm excited to try the other options.
a must go! Very fresh and the ladies up front are so kind and stress that they care about you. Do go!!

What a joint! Right out of German Town, Philly. If you know Steak Cheese or Deli sandwiches and chicken salad as good as grandma used to make it, then stop in here.
I lived in this town 30 years and snooped and supped, looking for the perfect Philly Cheese steak and this is it. I just happened upon the place, walked in and BAM, Joe was on me like a bird on a junebug. Pumpin' my hand, meetin' and greetin'.. 20 minutes and it like old home week. $6.80 for the real deal, full blown sandwich. Steak Cheese with pepper and onions... I had the potato salad and a dill pickle the size of your head. My wife had the Pastrami with cheese and onions, heated. She's no heavy eater so half had to come home in a bag, but she thought it to be mighty tasty as well.
Wow. I'm a goner. Thought Defalco's was good but since Greasy Tony's is no more this is tops in my book. It's a deli, so no valet parking!! It's cash only and that's okay by me 'cause it ain't pricey. They been in the same plkace 37 years and it's the first time I ever heard of the place. Shame on me and the Arizona Republic...
The sauce is super... I didn't have the meatball sandwich, only because I was on a steak cheese mission, but that will be next. It will have to wait a while 'cause I feel like a Boa that ate a small pig.
The place is hid out off McDonald Rd. , then south at Granite Reef, then it's just on the left by the Bashas'.
It's all about the meat, the bread, the folks!!! I'll stop now or you'll think I'm a shill.
Did I mention the chicken salad? Oooh yeah I did.... Enough

Tasty Italian back East style deli. Has been here for over 40 years. I think I've been here a long long time ago but will definitely be coming back. The family-run business is run by the Two Sisters which take great care and pride in their food and work. Definitely there to suggest different items. Fresh food made to order at a reasonable price. Definitely will be coming back more and more. Keep up the great work.
I've been coming to Casella's for years and have never been disappointed. The whole family is kind and inviting and they always make me feel valued when I come in.

THE BEST sandwiches in all of Arizona. Only blocks from home, I've been known to walk here for a cheesesteak. Their homemade pizzelles are great. The people here treat you like family, whether you have been here once or twice or are a regular.
Let me start with me I love hot sandwiches and this place is the best so far I ever tried in my life had steak works for lunch amazingggggg!!!!! Thanks definitely be back again and again

Nothing fancy about this place. I had to check it out because my boss has been lunching here for the past 10+ years. I now understand why.  The sandwiches and homemade deli salads are delicious. I had a Salami and Provolone sandwich the French roll was fresh as can be and I ordered a small potato salad that was as good as it looks. I also added a homemade brined kosher pickle, it was different , but not in a bad way , actually really good .  I highly recommend stopping off here, support your local restaurants ! Casella's is now in my top 5.

I found this place courtesy of my fellow yelpers and was pleased to find the ratings were genuine. 

The owner, who was originally from Philadelphia, came to Scottsdale in 1974 and opened the deli in 1977.  Yeah, I am a nosy guy.

The hot pastrami sandwich was really exceptional.  I came back the next day to try the Italian Hoagie.  I looked inside the sandwich and found capicola. Yummy!  I took an extra sandwich to go, but it was soggy the next day.  So you need to eat the sandwich right there.
Update -all six reviews 5 starts. Amazing. How come more people do not know about this place?

I go to Casella's once every week or two for their Italian Sub.  Best Italian sub in the Phoenxi/Scottsdale area.  Fresh components that taste great just amazing.  
The family that runs the place is great, warm, friendly, and gracious.

I live an hour west of Scottsdale. So whenever I'm in the area I hoots stop in.  Yummmm!  The chicken salad is the best,  and you won't be sorry if you order what "pops" says is an authentic philly. 
Luv luv this place!! Family owned. You'll luv it too
Looooovvvveeeeee this place. I have been going since middle school and cant get enough. For great food, friendly staff, and even better service this is the place for you
Great old school Italian sandwiches.  Family owned and operated.  Great, nice people and YUMMY food!  Cannoli is the best in AZ.  The chicken salad is excellent.  The meatballs are delicious.
